alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Limestone; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 6:31AM CDT until August 04 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Alabama and northwest Alabama, including the following counties, in north central Alabama, Limestone and Morgan. In northwest Alabama, Lauderdale. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in northwest Morgan, western Limestone and northeastern Lauderdale counties. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Decatur, Trinity, Rogersville, Lexington, Anderson, Coxey, Ripley, Cairo, Oliver, Good Springs and Whitehead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
